titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5825) to update the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-696, by Mr. Putnam.

In lieu of the amendments recommended by the Committee on the Judiciary and the Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence now printed in the bill, the amendment in the nature of a substitute printed in the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution shall be considered as adopted. During consideration of H.R. 5825 pursuant to this resolution, notwithstanding the operation of the previous question, the Chair may postpone further consideration of the bill to a time designated by the Speaker.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 241.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1052.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 225 - 197 (Roll no. 498).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 220 - 199 (Roll no. 499).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 9/28/2006--Passed House without amendment. Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 5825 (Electronic Surveillance Modernization Act).
